jobs.basic_qualifications:

- 5+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience
- 5+ years of leading design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
- Experience as a mentor, tech lead or leading an engineering team
- Bachelor's degree
jobs.description:
At Zappos/Shopbop Tech, we're on a mission to deliver unparalleled shopping experiences to our customers. We're seeking a Software Development Engineer III (SDE3) to join our Discovery Team, the heart of the customer journey across our premium fashion platforms. As an SDE3, you will help lead software development for the core customer journey on Zappos.com and Shopbop.com - from Homepage to checkout: Search, Search Results, Homepage, Ads, Widgets, Recommendations, and much more. If you're passionate about innovative products, thrive in dynamic environments, and excel in technical leadership, we would love to hear from you!

Key job responsibilities

- Lead and Innovate: Drive the development and maintenance of Java-based applications leveraging AWS services (ECS, SQS, S3, DynamoDB). Your work will ensure our architecture supports scalable, maintainable, and high-quality solutions.
- Collaborate for Success: Work hand-in-hand with product managers, UX designers, and engineers. Your role will be pivotal in creating optimal customer experiences, steering technology choices, and ensuring the architectural integrity of our systems.
- Mentor and Elevate: Guide junior developers, raising the coding standards bar and providing constructive feedback. Your expertise will help mold the next generation of engineers.
- Navigate Ambiguity: Tackle complex problems without a predefined technology strategy. You'll balance business needs with technical solutions, ensuring scalability and future growth.
- Champion Best Practices: Your code will not only solve problems efficiently but also serve as a benchmark for quality and best practices within the team.
- Continuous Learning and Leadership: As a key influencer in team strategy and goals, you'll foster an environment of growth, inclusivity, and open dialogue.

About the team
The Shopbop/Zappos Discovery Tech team owns the core backend services that power top-of-funnel product discovery across our platforms. Some of the services we own include: Content Service (manually scheduled content), Search API & Filters, Recommendations, Ads, Lists, and more. We partner closely with data scientists to launch new ranking algorithms in Search.

Key job responsibilities
- Lead and Innovate: Drive the development and maintenance of Java-based applications leveraging AWS services (ECS, SQS, S3, DynamoDB). Your work will ensure our architecture supports scalable, maintainable, and high-quality solutions.

- Collaborate for Success: Work hand-in-hand with product managers, UX designers, and engineers. Your role will be pivotal in creating optimal customer experiences, steering technology choices, and ensuring the architectural integrity of our systems.

- Mentor and Elevate: Guide junior developers, raising the coding standards bar and providing constructive feedback. Your expertise will help mold the next generation of engineers.

- Navigate Ambiguity: Tackle complex problems without a predefined technology strategy. You'll balance business needs with technical solutions, ensuring scalability and future growth.

- Champion Best Practices: Your code will not only solve problems efficiently but also serve as a benchmark for quality and best practices within the team.

- Continuous Learning and Leadership: As a key influencer in team strategy and goals, you'll foster an environment of growth, inclusivity, and open dialogue.



About the team
The Shopbop/Zappos Discovery Tech team owns the core backend services that power top-of-funnel product discovery across our platforms. Some of the services we own include: Content Service (manually scheduled content), Search API & Filters, Recommendations, Ads, Lists, and more. We partner closely with data scientists to launch new ranking algorithms in Search.

jobs.company_name: Amazon Servicos de Varejo do Brasil Ltda.
jobs.description:
Na Amazon, trabalhamos para ser a empresa mais centrada no cliente do mundo. Para isso, precisamos de pessoas excepcionalmente talentosas, brilhantes e motivadas.

A Amazon está buscando um Area Manager para nossa unidade. Como uma das marcas mais reconhecidas mundialmente, distribuímos milhões de produtos anualmente para nossos clientes leais.

Você terá foco em quatro áreas fundamentais: segurança, qualidade, experiência do cliente e produtividade do seu departamento.

Responsabilidades Principais:
- Analisar previsões de trabalho e determinar requisitos de produtividade diária para atingir os objetivos gerais da unidade
- Trabalhar em parceria com outros Area Managers para equilibrar a força de trabalho, garantindo uma operação balanceada e eficiente, enquanto atinge todas as metas
- Apoiar todos os programas de segurança e conformidade com normas regulamentadoras para garantir um ambiente de trabalho seguro para todos os associados
- Identificar e liderar proativamente iniciativas de melhoria de processos e ferramentas Lean

Requisitos:
- Formação superior completa
- Experiência em gestão de equipes
- Capacidade analítica e orientação para resultados
- Conhecimento em ferramentas de melhoria contínua

Condições de Trabalho:
- Escala 3x2 (3 dias de trabalho com 3 dias de folga, 2 dias de trabalho com 2 dias de folga)
- Turnos de 12 horas (06:00-18:00 ou 18:00-05:00)
- Disponibilidade para trabalhar em finais de semana
- Capacidade de levantar até 22kg
- Disposição para caminhar longas distâncias no armazém
- Permanecer em pé por até 12 horas
- Adaptação a diferentes condições ambientais
- Acesso a todas as áreas do prédio (incluindo escadas convencionais e tipo marinheiro)


Esta posição reporta ao Gerente de Operações ou Gerente Senior.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- Formation et expérience : Bac Pro, BTS, BUT ou équivalent (Bac+2 minimum) en maintenance industrielle, électrotechnique ou mécanique, avec expérience en maintenance électrique et mécanique ou une expérience sur un poste similaire pour une durée d'au moins de deux ans.
- Maintenance préventive et GMAO : Expérience prouvée avec les systèmes de maintenance préventive planifiée et maîtrise des plateformes GMAO
- Dépannage et diagnostic : Capacités avancées de dépannage sur équipements de manutention et systèmes d'automatisation, avec maîtrise de la lecture des plans mécaniques et électriques
- Compétences techniques : Expérience pratique avec systèmes de convoyeurs, contrôleurs moteur, variateurs de fréquence et technologies de capteurs
- Compétences opérationnelles : Connaissance des normes de santé et sécurité, fortes compétences organisationnelles et excellentes capacités de communication
jobs.description:
Technicien de Maintenance (F/H) Chaque jour, des millions de clients comptent sur Amazon pour recevoir leurs commandes à temps. Derrière cette promesse se cache un réseau d'automatisation sophistiqué où chaque seconde compte. En tant que Technicien/ne RME, vous serez au cœur de cette mécanique de précision, gardien des technologies qui permettent à nos centres de distribution de fonctionner 24h/24 et 7j/7.
Ce qui rend ce rôle unique ? Vous travaillerez sur des équipements à la pointe de la technologie, parfois conçus en interne, dans un environnement où l'innovation rencontre l'excellence opérationnelle. Votre expertise technique aura un impact direct et mesurable : chaque intervention réussie, c'est des milliers de colis qui arrivent à destination comme prévu.
Si vous adorez les challenges techniques, que vous vous épanouissez dans des environnements dynamiques et que vous voulez voir l'impact concret de votre travail à l'échelle mondiale, ce poste est fait pour vous.


Key job responsibilities
Responsabilités Clés
Garantir la sécurité et la conformité
• Promouvoir les meilleures pratiques de santé et sécurité dans toutes les activités de maintenance, en assurant la conformité totale aux normes et réglementations
• Effectuer des évaluations de risques et mettre en place des protocoles de sécurité pour les travaux de maintenance
Assurer l'excellence en maintenance préventive
• Exécuter des programmes complets de maintenance préventive planifiée sur des équipements automatisés diversifiés : convoyeurs, robots, systèmes de tri et d'emballage
• Utiliser les systèmes informatisés de gestion de la maintenance (GMAO) pour suivre, programmer et documenter les activités de maintenance
• Collaborer avec les fabricants d'équipements et prestataires externes pour optimiser les procédures de maintenance
Intervenir rapidement et résoudre les problèmes complexes
• Fournir une réponse rapide aux pannes d'équipement avec communication claire aux équipes opérationnelles
• Effectuer un dépannage avancé sur les systèmes électriques, mécaniques et d'automatisation complexes
• Utiliser les outils de diagnostic et documentation technique pour identifier efficacement les causes racines
Maîtriser les technologies d'automatisation
• Maintenir et configurer des systèmes d'automatisation sophistiqués incluant les contrôleurs logiques programmables (API) et réseaux de terrain
• Entretenir et calibrer les scanners de codes-barres, systèmes d'impression-application et équipements de tri
Contribuer à l'amélioration continue
• Analyser les données de performance des équipements pour identifier les opportunités d'amélioration
• Développer et mettre en œuvre des initiatives de réduction des coûts par l'optimisation des équipements
• Partager les connaissances techniques et encadrer les techniciens juniors


A day in the life
Horaires de travail : Ce poste fonctionne dans un environnement 24h/24 et 7j/7 nécessitant une flexibilité avec des horaires variables, incluant nuits, week-ends et jours fériés.
jobs.description_short: Technicien de Maintenance (F/H) Chaque jour, des millions de clients comptent sur Amazon pour recevoir leurs commandes à temps. Derrière cette promesse se cache un réseau d'automatisation sophistiqué où
jobs.preferred_qualifications:
- Certifications électriques : Habilitations électriques avec expérience en travaux d'ordre électrique et maintenance des contrôleurs moteur/variateurs
- Expertise en automatisation : Expérience avec systèmes Siemens (API), réseaux de terrain, robotique et systèmes automatisés de stockage/récupération
- Technologies de traçabilité : Expertise en configuration et maintenance de scanners de codes-barres et systèmes d'impression-application
- Technologie de maintenance 4.0: Utilisation et/ou exploitation des différentes technologies liées à la maintenance 4.0
- Leadership technique : Expérience d'encadrement de techniciens juniors avec compétences en rédaction technique pour la documentation
- Gestion de projets : Expérience en gestion de projet d'installations d'équipements et capacités multilingues (un atout)
- Machine de conditionnement: Entretien et mise au point de machine de conditionnement automatique

Amazon est un employeur engagé pour l'égalité des chances. Nous sommes convaincus qu'une main d'oeuvre diversifée est essentielle à notre réussite. Nous prenons nos décisions de recrutement en fonction de votre expérience et de vos compétences. Nous apprécions votre envie de découvrir, d'inventer, de simplifier et de construire. La protection de votre vie privée et la sécurité de vos données constituent depuis longtemps une priorité absolue pour Amazon. Veuillez consulter notre Politique de Confidentialité pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous collectons, utilisons et traitons les données personnelles de nos candidats.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 4+ years of site reliability engineering (SRE), systems engineering, systems administration, DevOps, security administration, or network administration experience
- 5+ years of Linux experience
- 5+ years of systems engineering experience
- Bachelor's degree in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, or related field or relevant work experience
- Experience in site reliability engineering (SRE), systems engineering, systems administration, DevOps, security administration, or network administration
- Experience working with Linux
- Experience in systems engineering
- Experience in any of the following: Python, Java, Perl, PHP, Ruby, Bash, Shell or equivalent
jobs.description:
Leo is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.

Export Control : This position requires that the candidate selected be a U.S. Citizen in order to comply with U.S. government-imposed requirements related to the nature of the work and/or where it will be performed.

We are seeking a highly experienced systems engineer to drive technical excellence in enterprise infrastructure deployment and operations across Leo's rapidly expanding global footprint. This role will be instrumental in designing and implementing critical infrastructure systems, establishing technical standards, and ensuring operational readiness across multiple facilities and technical environments.

A successful candidate is a technical leader who combines deep systems engineering expertise with strong architectural vision, has experience scaling infrastructure in regulated environments, and possesses comprehensive knowledge across network systems, security controls, and enterprise infrastructure domains. You will serve as a technical authority for infrastructure initiatives while mentoring team members and driving continuous improvement in our systems and processes.

This role requires 25% travel.

Key job responsibilities
Technical Leadership & Architecture:
- Serve as technical authority for infrastructure design and implementation across Leo's facilities
- Lead architecture and design of enterprise infrastructure systems including network, compute, and security
- Develop technical standards and specifications for infrastructure deployments
- Guide integration of infrastructure monitoring and management platforms
- Provide technical oversight for critical infrastructure programs
- Drive technical due diligence and risk assessment for new infrastructure initiatives

Systems Engineering & Implementation:
- Design and implement scalable infrastructure solutions across multiple technical domains
- Lead complex system integration efforts across network, compute, and security infrastructure
- Develop and validate infrastructure deployment architectures
- Create technical requirements and design documentation
- Implement infrastructure lifecycle management processes
- Drive security and compliance validation for infrastructure systems
- Establish monitoring and alerting frameworks for critical infrastructure

Technical Operations & Excellence:
- Define standard operating procedures and technical playbooks
- Lead troubleshooting of complex technical issues
- Guide capacity planning and infrastructure scaling initiatives
- Develop automated testing and validation frameworks
- Establish technical metrics and KPIs for infrastructure systems
- Drive continuous improvement in infrastructure reliability and performance

Leadership & Mentorship:
- Mentor other engineers and provide technical guidance to team members
- Review and approve technical designs and implementation plans
- Lead technical post-mortems and drive systematic improvements
- Collaborate with TPMs and stakeholders on technical strategy
- Represent technical perspective in program planning and execution

A day in the life
In this role, you will serve as a technical leader driving the design and implementation of mission-critical infrastructure across Leo's global operations. Your work will directly enable Leo's manufacturing, testing, and operational capabilities through robust and scalable infrastructure solutions.

A typical day may include:
- Leading technical design reviews for new infrastructure deployments
- Working with network engineers to validate various configurations
- Collaborating with security teams on implementing standardized physical and logical security controls
- Reviewing monitoring dashboards and analyzing infrastructure performance metrics
- Troubleshooting complex system integration issues across multiple technical domains
- Mentoring team members on infrastructure design and implementation best practices
- Developing technical specifications for new infrastructure initiatives
- Conducting operational readiness reviews for critical systems
- Collaborating with TPMs and stakeholders to align technical solutions with program objectives
- Contributing to infrastructure automation and optimization strategies

This position offers a unique opportunity to shape the technical foundation of Leo's infrastructure while working with advanced technologies in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment. You'll be at the forefront of designing and implementing the systems that enable Leo's ambitious global mission.

About the team
You'll be joining a newly formed infrastructure program team within Enterprise Technology, focused on building and scaling the foundation that enables Leo's ambitious mission. Our team combines deep technical expertise with strong program management capabilities to deliver critical infrastructure on time and at scale.

We operate with a startup mindset while leveraging Amazon's resources and best practices. Our culture emphasizes ownership, data-driven decision making, and innovation in solving complex problems.

We're building something that's never been done before, and we're looking for individuals who are excited about creating new solutions rather than following established playbooks.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 3+ years leading large-scale technical or engineering programs with proven thought leadership, business case development, and successful delivery
- 2+ years in customer-facing roles engaging with executives, technologists, or partners to solve business problems with advanced technologies
- Bachelor's degree in science, technology, engineering, math, business, or equivalent experience leading technical and non-technical transformation projects across broad functional teams

jobs.company_name: Amazon AWS Services Brazil Ltd - E07
jobs.description:
This position is part of the AWS Specialist and Partner Organization (ASP), where Specialists own end-to-end go-to-market strategies for their technology domains and Partner teams drive strategy, recruiting, and growth of key technology and consulting partners. Together, they provide customers with expertise and scale to build innovative solutions for complex challenges.

As a Senior Observability Customer Success Specialist within the ASP Customer Success Center of Excellence, you will drive enterprise adoption and value realization for customers in their post-launch observability journeys. You'll engage and build relationships across customer personas in our largest and most strategic enterprise customers across Latin America. The ideal candidate will be technically credible in observability solutions (commercial and open source), effectively shape customer journeys, and develop team capabilities. Enterprise experience with observability platforms, distributed systems monitoring, and modern DevOps practices is essential.

This deeply cross-functional role engages with AWS teams across sales, solutions architecture, and services, working at the CxO level to maximize customers' observability investments. You will develop customer success strategies, create playbooks, and build scalable frameworks combining strategic thinking with operational excellence and technical expertise. Working closely with Observability GTM, Customer Success Specialist teams, partners, and Professional Services, you will support service adoption plans.

AWS serves millions of customers in more than 190 countries. As organizations increasingly rely on cloud-native applications and distributed systems, full-stack observability has become critical to collecting, correlating, and analyzing telemetry across network, infrastructure, and applications in cloud, hybrid, or on-premises environments to gain insights into system behavior, performance, and health.


Key job responsibilities
Strategic Customer Engagement:
- Work directly with customers to implement observability solutions, from basic monitoring to advanced AIOps implementations
- Develop, execute, and test adoption plays for enterprise value realization in collaboration with CloudOps domain teams and scale programs through Observability domain and partner success teams
- Collaborate with AWS Customer Success Specialists to assess customer needs, deliver tailored technical workshops, and accelerate time to value
- Orchestrate executive alignment and stakeholder buy-in for adoption initiatives and customer advocacy programs

Adoption Program Development:
- Create and maintain best practices documentation, implementation guides, training materials, and governance frameworks for sustainable adoption at scale
- Track and analyze adoption metrics to measure effectiveness and identify improvement areas

Customer Success Management:
- Design and monitor customer health dashboards, proactively address risks or adoption barriers, and drive customer advocacy through success story documentation

Product Feedback Loop:
- Collect and communicate customer feedback, insights, and requirements to Go-To-Market teams and analyze trends to identify product improvements

Required Technical Knowledge:
- Expertise with observability platforms including AWS native services (CloudWatch, CloudTrail), open-source solutions (Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry), and commercial solutions (Datadog, New Relic, Splunk, Dynatrace)
- Understanding of modern application architectures (microservices, containers, serverless), DevOps practices, and SRE principles


About the team
Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.

jobs.title: Senior Observability Customer Success Specialist, AWS Specialist and Partner Organization

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent, or experience working with partners through account, product or program management and business development engagements
- Experience managing cross-functional projects and initiatives
- Experience collaborating and influencing multiple teams across multiple organizations
- Proven track record of implementing value realization frameworks at scale
jobs.description:
As a Partner Success Specialist (PSS) within the AWS Specialists & Partners (ASP) org, you will be responsible for scaling AWS's customer success methodologies across our partner ecosystem to drive measurable business outcomes and accelerate customer value realization. You will architect and implement frameworks that enable partners to drive and measure customer value post-implementation. This role combines strategic enablement with hands-on execution to establish partners as extensions of AWS's customer success organization.

We're looking for individuals with:
- Deep expertise in partner enablement and post-sale value delivery
- Strong program management and operational excellence capabilities
- Proven ability to influence and drive change across complex organizations
- Experience working with enterprise partners and cloud services
- Experience using AI to automate and scale work more effectively


Key job responsibilities
Strategy and Approach:
- Align partner success strategies with AWS growth objectives
- Adapt CS CoE 'Activate to Advocate' framework for partners
- Create partner success metrics, health scores, playbooks, and governance models
- Architect scalable measurement approaches for partner-led outcomes and contribute to AWS Value Realization Toolkit

Partner Enablement and Program Execution:
- Enable partners to build customer success practices impacting business models
- Guide partners post-sale and deploy health frameworks and interventions
- Build adoption, change management, and engagement toolkits
- Coach partners on systematic value realization approaches and build feedback mechanisms to evolve frameworks
- Measure and track partner-led value realization through milestones, metrics, and KPIs

Organizational Leadership & Influence:
- Partner with PDMs and collaborate with Partner Sales to drive framework adoption and accelerate consumption
- Work with Partner Development Specialists on industry playbooks
- Build cross-AWS relationships to drive program adoption
- Influence senior stakeholders on organizational transformation and develop business cases demonstrating ROI

About the team
About AWS

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. jobs.title: Partner Success Specialist, AWS Specialist and Partner Organization

jobs.basic_qualifications: - Baccalauréat technologique ou professionnel (ou équivalent international) dans une discipline d’ingénierie ou autre certification en ingénierie validée par un stage Expérience préalable en tant qu’ingénieur qualifié Expérience préalable dans le domaine de la maintenance mécanique et/ou électrique Parfaite maîtrise de la langue locale, à l’oral et à l’écrit
jobs.description:
En assurant le fonctionnement continu des machines essentielles à nos activités, l’équipe RME (Reliability Maintenance Engineering) d’Amazon joue un rôle fondamental pour nos opérations. En tant que technicien RME, vous assurerez la maintenance d’un large éventail d’équipements et d’espaces de travail tout en respectant les meilleures pratiques en matière de santé et de sécurité. Vous contribuerez à la sécurité de vos collègues et à la prévention des temps d’arrêt des machines. Nos techniciens RME améliorent la disponibilité et la qualité de nos équipements et travaillent pour optimiser notre environnement opérationnel.

Key job responsibilities
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance proactive et préventive sur les équipements du site
Effectuer des tâches de réparation réactives et diagnostiquer les pannes dans un centre de distribution fonctionnel
Utiliser les meilleurs outils pour optimiser le fonctionnement des équipements
Respecter toutes les politiques et pratiques en matière de santé et de sécurité
Soutenir le développement et la progression des apprentis sur le site
Travailler sur des projets d’amélioration continue et appliquer les meilleures pratiques sur plusieurs de nos sites au sein de l’UE

A day in the life
Nos techniciens RME sont basés sur site, afin de répondre rapidement à tout problème technique affectant nos opérations. Vous effectuerez une série de travaux de maintenance préventive planifiée sur les équipements en place sur nos sites afin de vous assurer qu’ils fonctionnent et ne présentent aucun risque de sécurité. En tant que technicien RME, vous interviendrez rapidement en cas de panne, et vous mènerez l’enquête pour détecter les pannes et les solutionner aussi vite que possible. Il vous appartiendra également de faire des suggestions pour améliorer durablement les processus.
En collaboration avec des collègues expérimentés, vous effectuerez des tâches de maintenance quotidiennes telles que la peinture et la plomberie et assurerez la liaison avec les sous-traitants externes en cas de besoin si nécessaire. Vous travaillerez en équipe afin de vous assurer que nos sites bénéficient d’une assistance 24 heures sur 24, ce qui permet à Amazon de livrer ses produits à la vitesse qui fait sa réputation.

About the team
Notre équipe d’ingénieurs RME (Reliability Maintenance Engineering) veille à ce que nos équipements fonctionnent au mieux. Guidés par des responsables expérimentés, nous sommes une équipe à l’esprit analytique. Nos collaborateurs·trices possèdent à la fois des connaissances techniques poussées et un bon esprit d’équipe. Nous travaillons ensemble pour assurer l’entretien, le dépannage et la réparation des ressources de notre réseau mondial de centres d’expédition. Certains de nos employé·es occupent des postes à responsabilités et sont chargés de superviser l’équipe dans son travail sur des technologies passionnantes, dont certaines n’existent que chez Amazon.
De l’installation de systèmes d’emballage automatisés à la supervision de la maintenance générale d’un site, en passant par la réparation d’équipements de distribution essentiels, notre équipe assure le bon fonctionnement de la plupart des éléments techniques d’Amazon. Nous veillons, par exemple, à ce que les bâtiments soient conformes à la législation, afin d’assurer la sécurité de tous et le fonctionnement à plein régime de nos sites. Les possibilités d’évolution sont nombreuses, tant au sein de l’équipe RME qu’à l’échelle d’Amazon.
Tout ce que nous faisons vise à réduire les temps d’arrêt dans les principaux sites logistiques d’Amazon, afin que les clients reçoivent leurs commandes à temps. Nous travaillons souvent tôt ou tard pour effectuer les tâches de maintenance avec un minimum de perturbations, y compris en équipes de nuit. Si nous voyons qu’il existe une méthodologie plus aboutie pour faire les choses, nous avons les compétences nécessaires pour développer et introduire des processus nouveaux ou des technologies de pointe, comme Amazon Robotics ou notre robot de tri ultra sophistiqué.
jobs.description_short: En assurant le fonctionnement continu des machines essentielles à nos activités, l’équipe RME (Reliability Maintenance Engineering) d’Amazon joue un rôle fondamental pour nos opérations. En tant que technicien
jobs.preferred_qualifications:
- Connaissance de la surveillance basée sur l’état des machines Connaissance des machines d’impression et d’application Expérience dans le diagnostic de pannes et dans la maintenance de systèmes de convoyage ou d’automatisation

Amazon est un employeur engagé pour l'égalité des chances. Nous sommes convaincus qu'une main d'oeuvre diversifée est essentielle à notre réussite. Nous prenons nos décisions de recrutement en fonction de votre expérience et de vos compétences. Nous apprécions votre envie de découvrir, d'inventer, de simplifier et de construire. La protection de votre vie privée et la sécurité de vos données constituent depuis longtemps une priorité absolue pour Amazon. Veuillez consulter notre Politique de Confidentialité pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous collectons, utilisons et traitons les données personnelles de nos candidats.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 3+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
- 5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
- 3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent
- Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
- Experience with Excel
- Experience with SQL
- Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
jobs.description:
re you passionate about automation, designing processes, simplifying work and launching innovative products technology?

We are looking for a Big Data Application Engineering Manager who will lead a team of Big Data Application Engineers and have the ability to deep dive into systems and invent and simplify with a high degree of ownership.

Impact
Ever wondered how Amazon offers the Earth's biggest selection and still manages to offer lower prices every day to our customers? Our retail business teams work with a massive array of vendors and business financial performance metrics to expand selection and drive costs lower. Given the rapid growth of our business, this requires our category leaders, financial analysts, site merchandisers and vendor managers to quickly analyze vendors, categories and brands, diving deep into data showing business efficiency down to the unit sale level. The technology that enables this has huge visibility and impact and is critical to Amazon's continued profitability and growth.

Innovation
We're working on the future. If you are seeking an environment where you can drive innovation. If you want to apply state-of-the-art software technologies to solve real world problems. If you want the satisfaction of providing visible benefit to end-users in an iterative fast paced environment, this is your opportunity. The responsibilities of this role will be key in paving the future of Amazon Retail and transforming how we do business.

Opportunity
You will be part of a team of creative, top-notch engineers who work hard, have fun, and make history.

This role is on the Chronicle team within Selling Partner Services. We own the Turismo product suite, which is powered by Ripple, a dynamic query engine. Turismo is a well loved product, with 15k+ users globally. Ripple is a PrestoDB based query engine that is built to scale, and processes 2M+ queries per week. We are a full stack team, with Product managers, UX designers, TPMs, SDEs, DEs and Data Scientists.

We are seeking a Business Analyst who Owns the We are seeking a Business Analyst who will own the comprehensive metrics framework and metadata repository, serving as the central point of accountability for metric definitions, relationships, and data quality across business domains. This role acts as the primary liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders, diving deep into customer inquiries to translate complex data questions into actionable insights while maintaining rigorous documentation of metric lineage and business context.

Key job responsibilities
Respond to customer questions across 12+ external and internal surfaces where Ripple metrics are used by Selling Partners and internal Amazonians, ensuring timely and accurate resolution of data inquiries

Develop deep expertise in the Ripple tech stack and conduct thorough deep dives into complex data issues, identifying root causes and providing comprehensive analysis

Write complex SQL queries and Python scripts to extract, transform, and analyze data from petabyte-scale data warehouses with a focus on query efficiency and performance optimization

Automate recurring deep dive analyses to enable customer self-service for frequently asked questions, reducing manual effort and improving response times
Own and maintain metadata in the Metric Knowledge Service (MKS), ensuring accuracy, completeness, and accessibility of metric definitions and relationships

Partner effectively with Product Managers and Selling Partners through excellent written and verbal communication, translating technical concepts into business language

Leverage expert proficiency in SQL, Excel, ETL processes, and data visualization tools (QuickSight, Power BI, or similar platforms) to transform raw data into actionable insights

Define business requirements and use data and metrics to draw meaningful insights that inform strategic initiatives

Manage large datasets while conducting advanced statistical analyses to support business decisions
